titleStmt.title: An answer to those questions propounded by the Parliament to the Assembly of Divines, touching jus divinum in matter of church-government. Wherein is clearly proved from Scripture, that the Presbyterial government is jure devino, of divine institution, and according to the will and appointment of Jesus Christ. Licensed, and published according to order.
titleStmt.author: Bakewell, Thomas, b. 1618 or 19.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for William Ley, and are to be sold at his shop at Pauls Chain, neer Doctors Commons.,

notesStmt.note: Though this is generally attributed to Thomas Bakewell (also known as Bathwell), who matriculated at Oxford April 17, 1635, received his M.A. in 1641, and who was ejected in 1661, Thomason attributes it to a Thomas Bathwell, woolmonger.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "by Thomas Bathwell"; "by Tho: Bathwell woolmonger in [illegible]"; "June 17th".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
